title: Lockheed Launches Search After Finance Chief Departs Suddenly
summary: Treasurer John Mollard will manage the defense giant's finances in the interim. Aerospace and defense giant Lockheed Martin Corp. named a longtime company veteran to take over as acting chief financial officer following the sudden exit of its current CFO.

title: Activision Blizzard Executives Exit as Company Faces Gender-Bias Lawsuit
summary: A California agency accused the company of failing to respond to employee complaints of harassment, discrimination and retaliation. Activision Blizzard Inc. said the head of its Blizzard Entertainment unit and a senior human-resources executive are leaving the company, as the videogame publisher seeks to stabilize its business after a gender-bias lawsuit and calls to improve its culture.

title: Lyft Achieves Earnings Milestone
summary: Cost cuts and returning riders buoy the ride-hailing company, though rising Covid-19 infections present renewed challenge. Lyft Inc. achieved a measure of profitability a quarter earlier than expected, marking a surprising comeback after the pandemic initially crushed demand for its ride-share service and later left it dealing with driver shortages.

title: U.S. Issues New Eviction Moratorium
summary: Move came after protest at Capitol by progressives urging action by White House. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration Tuesday announced a new federal moratorium on evictions, bowing to pressure from progressive Democrats to revive lapsed tenant protections despite White House officials saying they lacked the legal authority to do so.

title: Lyft Makes Its Move in Race for Profits
summary: Latest results show it could pay to be the little guy in the ride-hailing industry, but Covid-19 business challenges remain. Lyft wants to prove it can be the Simone Biles of technology-small but mighty.

title: Can You Ask About Someone's Covid-19 Vaccination Status?
summary: Talking about vaccination is tricky. Here's how to ask at work, with friends and with family. Friends, co-workers and relatives are asking each other one tricky question: Are you vaccinated?

title: The Eviction Ban Has to End Sometime
summary: Tenants and landlords have to work it out, and better now than later.. As Democrats push to renew the nationwide ban on evictions that expired Saturday, they're squabbling-er, screaming-over who's failing the party's progressive base. Speaker Nancy Pelosi puts the onus on President Biden, urging him to act unilaterally. The White House says it lacks legal authority, as the Supreme Court recently made clear.

title: The Andrew Cuomo Standard
summary: If Democrats take sexual harassment seriously, they'll move to impeach.. We're about to find out if Democrats believe what they say about having no tolerance for sexual harassment. If they do, then they have little choice other than to move to impeach Andrew Cuomo as Governor of New York.

title: Your Vaccine Papers, Please
summary: New York's mayor will punish you until you get the Covid-19 shot.. The modern progressive speaks the language of high-minded purpose but always ends with coercion. Witness New York Mayor Bill de Blasio, the uber progressive, who announced Tuesday that New Yorkers will soon need proof of vaccination to do everything from dining out to working out at a gym. He's proud that New York is the first U.S. city to impose such a mandate.

title: A Digital Trade Opportunity in Asia
summary: Biden's trade rep is too cautious about a new pact with Pacific allies.. The Biden Administration says it's eager to build better relationships with allies abroad, and a good chance to prove it concerns trade in Asia. A comprehensive trade deal such as the old Trans-Pacific Partnership seems to be political dead letter in Washington, alas, but a new opportunity for U.S. leadership is emerging around digital trade.

title: KKR Earnings Surge as Firm Rakes In Record Cash From Investors
summary: Value of flagship private-equity portfolio gained 13% during the quarter, topping gains in the S&P 500. KKR & Co. reported a big jump in second-quarter earnings and hauled in a record amount of new cash from investors, as the value of its private-equity portfolio climbed.

title: If Biden Is Serious About Covid, He'll Protect the Border
summary: The government releases migrants, untested, to live in tight spaces alongside scores of strangers.. If it's unfair to lay all blame for the mess on the southern border at the feet of President Biden, his administration certainly deserves the lion's share.

title: A False Narrative About 'Misinformation' and Covid Vaccines
summary: The evidence suggests resistance is based largely on pre-existing attitudes, not bad information.. The idea that recent, deliberate misinformation campaigns created hesitancy to the Covid-19 vaccine appears itself to be misinformation.

title: Bernie Sanders: Why We Need the $3.5 Trillion Reconciliation Package
summary: The American Rescue Plan boosted the economy during the pandemic. But it didn't go far enough.. The good news is that the American Rescue Plan Act, enacted in March, has been effective. At a time of unprecedented health and economic crisis caused by the pandemic, it did exactly what a democratic government in a civilized society is supposed to do: respond to the needs of people in despair.

title: A Priest Finds Serenity in Humor
summary: 'It was just our Lord, in one of his most unrecognizable forms.' I hope he didn't mean me.. Amid the rancor dividing Americans, how do we learn to see one another as countrymen again? I reconnected recently with an old friend and Jesuit priest, Daniel Sweeney, with the intention of asking him.

title: Florida Sees Record Covid-19 Hospitalizations, as Delta Variant Surges
summary: State trails only Louisiana in seven-day rate of new cases, federal data show. Covid-19 hospitalizations in Florida have reached a record high, federal data show, as the state battles a surge in cases brought on by the highly contagious Delta variant.

title: Crypto 'Wild West' Needs Stronger Investor Protection, SEC Chief Says
summary: Gary Gensler highlights platforms that allow investors to borrow against cryptocurrencies. WASHINGTON-The Securities and Exchange Commission will regulate cryptocurrency markets to the maximum extent possible using its existing authority, Chairman Gary Gensler said Tuesday, while also calling on Congress to grant the agency more scope and resources to oversee the sector.

title: Amgen Disputes IRS Claim It Owes $3.6 Billion in Back Taxes
summary: Company reported drop in second-quarter profit as a result of write-off tied to acquisition of Five Prime Therapeutics. Amgen Inc. said it is gearing up for a fight with the Internal Revenue Service over a bill for billions of dollars in back taxes.

title: Pentagon Police Officer Is Fatally Stabbed
summary: Suspect fatally shot, others injured in confrontation at nearby transit station. A Pentagon police officer was stabbed to death Tuesday and a suspect was fatally shot by law enforcement during a confrontation that erupted at a transit station outside the Pentagon, sending the complex into lockdown, authorities said.

title: Disney Meets an Avenger
summary: Talent and originality will not take a back seat to the streaming land grab forever.. Get out your hankies for the latest Scarlett Johansson epic, a story of leverage lost and found.

title: 'All the Frequent Troubles of Our Days' Review: The Ballad of Mildred Harnack
summary: The story of the forgotten American woman at the heart of the German resistance to Hitler, as told by her great-great-niece.. On Feb. 16, 1943, by special order of Adolf Hitler, Mildred Harnack, a 40-year-old American academic, was executed at Plötzensee prison in Berlin. She had been accused of treason for her role in an underground German resistance group that had put up anti-Nazi posters, distributed seditious leaflets, and helped Jews and dissidents to escape the country.

title: Trump Won't Block Former Justice Officials From Testifying
summary: Congressional committees are probing Trump administration efforts to invalidate Biden win. WASHINGTON-Former President Donald Trump won't sue to block former Justice Department officials from testifying before two congressional committees investigating his administration's efforts to overturn President Biden's victory, his lawyer said in a letter this week.

title: Spirit, American Airlines Cancel and Delay Flights a Third Day
summary: Storms and staffing shortages have stranded passengers, snarled flights. Spirit Airlines Inc. canceled over half its flights Tuesday as the airline continues to grapple with an operational meltdown that has thrown its operation into disarray for three consecutive days.

title: U.S. Has Shared 110 Million Covid-19 Vaccine Doses Overseas
summary: Biden administration had aimed to deliver 80 million doses by the end of June. WASHINGTON-President Biden said Tuesday his administration has shipped more than 110 million Covid-19 vaccine doses to 65 countries, as it works to share supply with the rest of the world following regulatory and logistical setbacks.

title: Optimistic Ad Campaigns Collide With Rise in Covid-19 Cases
summary: A gap is showing between hopeful advertising and rebounding infections. Ad campaigns celebrating life after the worst of the Covid-19 pandemic are contrasting with rebounding infections, the spread of the highly transmissible Delta variant and renewed restrictions designed to fight the virus.

title: Another Union Vote at Alabama Amazon Site Faces Uncertain Path
summary: Amazon is expected to challenge labor official's recommendation for a new vote. A recommendation by a National Labor Relations Board official has opened the door for a redo of a unionization vote at an Amazon . com Inc. facility in Alabama, renewing the possibility for a breakthrough victory for organized labor.

title: Robinhood's Stock Jumps, Reversing Faltering IPO Debut
summary: Shares of popular trading app rose to $46.80 on Tuesday, up from initial-public-offering price of $38. Shares of Robinhood Markets Inc. jumped Tuesday, surging past the company's initial-public offering price in a reversal from last week's underwhelming trading debut.

title: Marriott Posts Quarterly Gains, Sees Business Travel Picking Up This Fall
summary: The hotel chain turned a profit for the April-to-June quarter as revenue more than doubled. Marriott International Inc. posted gains for the June quarter, driven by leisure travel, as the company keeps an eye on the spread of the Delta variant, executives said.

title: Cuomo's Problems Underscore a Changing Democratic Party
summary: Damning report on governor's conduct shines light on shifting party power structure, rise of new priorities and difficulty in steering clear of internal warfare. A damning report on Gov. Andrew Cuomo's conduct in office explores deeply important questions involving the problems of sexual harassment and toxic workplace environments.

title: Stocks Climb, Boosted by Earnings Optimism
summary: A solid earnings season has spurred hope that stocks can continue to grind higher. U.S. stocks advanced broadly Tuesday, bouncing back from earlier losses to bring the S&P 500 to a closing high.

title: NYC to Require Vaccination for Many Indoor Activities
summary: Move is an effort to increase number of people vaccinated against Covid-19, mayor says. New York City will require people to show proof of vaccination for indoor activities, such as dining, gyms and events, Mayor Bill de Blasio said Tuesday.

title: PepsiCo to Sell Tropicana, Naked Juice Brands
summary: PAI Partners to pay $3.3 billion for a controlling stake in juice business. PepsiCo Inc. plans to sell the Tropicana orange juice brand to a private-equity firm, parting ways with one of its most famous holdings in a bid to boost growth.

title: Lumen Technologies to Sell U.S. Telecom Assets to Apollo for $7.5 Billion
summary: Investment firm to carve out new company aimed at accelerating fiber transition. Lumen Technologies Inc. plans to sell a swath of its U.S. telecommunications network to Apollo Global Management Inc. for $7.5 billion including debt, officials from the companies said.

title: Stanley Black & Decker to Mandate Masks for U.S. Employees Starting Friday, CFO Says
summary: The tool maker won't require vaccinations for its staff, fearing that workers might quit or strike, according to Donald Allan Jr.. Tool maker Stanley Black & Decker Inc. will require its U.S. employees to wear masks regardless of their vaccination status starting Friday, but won't mandate inoculations for fear workers might quit or strike, the company's finance chief said.

title: Bowl Game (Wednesday Crossword, August 4)
UAW, Car Companies to Require Masks Regardless of Vaccination Status
summary: Rule applies to vaccinated employees; Chipotle also tells workers to wear masks, while Microsoft to require vaccination. Detroit's car companies are requiring workers to resume wearing masks, citing new federal guidelines and the recent rise in Covid-19 cases from the Delta variant.

title: Two More Police Officers Who Responded to Capitol Attack Died by Suicide
summary: Deaths bring number of suicides among officers engaged during riot to four. WASHINGTON-Washington's Metropolitan Police Department said that two more officers who responded to the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol have died by suicide.

title: Natural Gas Becomes Hot Commodity
summary: Record exports, steamy weather and frugal producers are pushing up prices for the fuel. The heat wave that scorched the West has dissipated, but natural-gas prices have yet to cool off.

title: Obama Turns 60
summary: The former president rejects the latest Covid panic, but still battles community organizers in Chicago.. America's 44th president is turning 60 this week. This column joins millions around the world in wishing Barack Obama a happy birthday and applauds his desire to try to avoid trendy Covid panic in favor of a beachfront celebration with friends and admirers.

title: As SPAC Creators Get Rich, How Incentives Are Shared Remains Murky
summary: Some investment executives who back SPACs keep lucrative benefits known as 'sponsor promotes' for themselves rather than share with clients. Many investment executives who back special-purpose acquisition companies are scoring big paydays as more deals get completed. Some of their clients are missing out.

title: Auto Makers Warn Chip Shortage Will Continue to Affect Production
summary: GM idles truck plants again, Jeep maker Stellantis sees lack of semiconductors hurting its operations. The global computer-chip shortage continues to trip up the world's largest car makers with some executives predicting it could weigh on operations well into the second half of this year.

title: NCAA Found to Undervalue Women's Basketball
summary: The analysis by a law firm hired by the NCAA says its drive to support the men's tournament over all else perpetuates gender inequities. The NCAA has undervalued its annual women's basketball tournament by tens of millions of dollars and should overhaul how it operates and sells rights to the event, according to a critical report by a law firm the NCAA hired to analyze gender inequities in its championships.

title: Local Acts, Colder Weather: Music Festivals Are Back, but Different
summary: Festival producers scramble to bring back live concerts, whatever the weather. Or venue. Or lineup.. Four days before the Day Trip electronic music festival was set to begin in California last month, organizer Pasquale Rotella posted a video to Instagram telling ticket holders that it was changing venues for the second time.

title: Taliban Commander Was Released From Prison Last Year, Officials Say
summary: Resume Subscription. KABUL-The Taliban commander overseeing an assault on the key southern city of Lashkargah is one of 5,000 former prisoners released by the Afghan government last year under pressure from the U.S., Afghan and Western officials say.

summary: Eggplant, peppers, onions, tomatoes and Romano beans cook quickly and look beautiful, layered in an appealing crosshatch pattern. summary: Eggplant, peppers, onions, tomatoes and Romano beans cook quickly and look beautiful, layered in an appealing crosshatch pattern. LOOKS ARE AS IMPORTANT as taste in chef Ryan Bartlow's third Slow Food Fast recipe-which is certainly not to say it's fussy.

title: Obama Plans to Host Hundreds at Birthday Party on Martha's Vineyard
summary: Outdoor event set for this weekend is drawing some GOP criticism, as nation grapples with surging Delta variant Covid-19 cases. Former President Barack Obama is planning a 60th birthday party with hundreds of guests at his Martha's Vineyard vacation home this weekend, as the nation brings back some Covid-19 precautions to combat a rising tide of Delta-variant cases.

title: Tyson Foods to Require Vaccines for All U.S. Workers
summary: Move draws pushback from some union leaders. Tyson Foods Inc.'s decision Tuesday to require Covid-19 vaccinations for its entire U.S. workforce drew pushback from some union leaders, signaling tensions between management and workers over stepped-up efforts to guard against the disease.

title: The Best Smokeless Fire Pits for Outdoor Entertaining-Without the Stench
summary: Stoke the flames but skip the smelly, eye-stinging smoke. These high-tech fire pits, all $350 or less, are built for worry-free grilling and socializing.. JILL BARTNICK had always wanted a fire pit to cozily roast marshmallows and grill hot dogs with friends. What she didn't want: the smoke such stoves inevitably spew. "Any time I go to a buddy's house and we have a bonfire, it's so much fun, but we reek until we wash our clothes and hair," the Atlanta customer success manager said, adding that she also worried about smoking out nearby houses in her densely packed community.

title: Hawaii's Treasured Time-Warp Hotels
summary: The Manago Hotel, on the Big Island, opened more a century ago and feels remarkably unchanged, down to the restaurant's famous pork chops. Plus other beloved hotels on Maui and in Waikiki that evoke 'Old Hawaii.'. For the Time Capsule series, we spotlight a cherished restaurant, hotel or landmark that's changed remarkably little over the years. This week, we visit the Manago Hotel in Hawaii.

title: The Coming Eviction Crisis
summary: States, localities, the Biden administration and Congress all deserve some blame.. Millions of Americans-mainly lower and middle-income workers-lost their jobs last year amid the pandemic and couldn't pay the rent. Congress enacted a limited and temporary moratorium on evictions, which ended in July 2020.

title: The U.S. Won Afghanistan Before Losing It
summary: Victory came quickly to the CIA and special forces in October 2001. Then the mission changed to a self-defeating invasion.. The tragedy of the U.S. retreat from Afghanistan is that days after 9/11, President George W. Bush had settled on a plan based on principles that could have ensured enduring success.

title: The Secret Japanese Gym Where Simone Biles Trained for Her Olympic Comeback
summary: Simone Biles needed a private place to learn to do gymnastics again. The Americans called a Japanese professor, who had a facility an hour outside of Tokyo where she could escape the public eye.. TOKYO-Early Wednesday morning last week, the phone of Juntendo University professor Kazuhiro Aoki rang. On the line was an American with a discreet request: There was a gymnast who needed to use the school's gym.

title: Alibaba Posts Lower Profit as Chinese Tech Giant Boosts Spending
summary: Company bolsters new services as it faces more competition in China's e-commerce market. Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. reported an increase in revenue in the latest quarter, but profits fell as the e-commerce behemoth invested heavily in new business ventures and user growth.

title: Stacking Stones Gets a Rocky Reception
summary: Resume Subscription. DUNBAR, Scotland-For lovers of the outdoors, it is one of the most polarizing questions of our times: Is it ever okay to stack big piles of stones?

title: How Long Can BMW Resist Tesla's Pull?
summary: The German car maker remains more cautious than peers in both its profit guidance and its electric-vehicle strategy. One of the less discussed ways in which Tesla 's Elon Musk has changed the automotive industry concerns financial communication: Underpromising in order to overdeliver is out, advertising expensive growth plans is in.

title: 'Death by Grubhub Delivery'
summary: Traffic laws and the kind of society that flouts them.. Regarding Warren Kozak's "Social Breakdown Starts With Skipping a Stop Sign" (op-ed, July 26): New York City is a mess. Each time I venture out, I have doubts that I will return home unscathed. Will it be death by Grubhub delivery, or maybe a bicycle going the wrong way, on the sidewalk or through a red light? Perhaps I'll be taken out, like Broadway actress Lisa Banes, by a scooter. She was hit by a scooter running a red light on June 4 and died of her injuries 10 days later. Was anyone ever arrested for that? Anything that has wheels should have a license. Cyclists going the wrong way or riding on sidewalks should be fined and have their bicycles impounded.

title: Bobby Fischer Inspires Women to Play Chess, Too
summary: He was dedicated, heart and soul, to the purity of the game.. I enjoyed Jennifer Shahade's "Make Way for the Queens of Chess" (op-ed, July 17), but I'm disappointed to see Bobby Fischer demonized as a sexist obstacle to women's progress in chess. Fischer remains the inspiration for young chess players of both sexes (see the final credit of Netflix's "The Queen's Gambit"). He was a singular talent who defied worldly powers-the Russian chess conglomerate, the U.S. Chess Federation, Nixon and Kissinger-to become the only American world chess champion.

title: Accelerating Medical Innovation in Time for Baby Boomers
summary: Just as Darpa created the internet and GPS, ARPA-H could fund medical breakthroughs in cancer and Alzheimer's.. When a philanthropist as prominent in medical innovation as Michael Milken advocates for the creation of a government agency, we should take notice ("Covid Is the 21st Century's Sputnik," op-ed, July 28). The private sector will always be the main engine for innovation. But that engine needs a catalyst to fire initially. Ideally, the Advanced Research Projects Agency for Health (ARPA-H) could be that initiator-assuming it can avoid the bureaucratic pitfalls that plague more established government agencies.

title: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the U.S. National Debt
summary: It will never be paid off-and that's OK.. Thomas Kahn's statement, "We don't need billions of dollars more debt" ("A Democrat Against Deficits," op-ed, July 29) reflects a bookkeeper's mentality, not an economist's. The U.S. public national debt is good: It leverages economic growth and reflects the excellent creditworthiness of the U.S.

title: Politicians Can't Hurt Us From Outer Space
summary: Don't hold back. Send the entire Congress.. "The U.S. Should Send a President to Space"-what a great idea by Christopher Mulder and Raphael Piliero (op-ed, July 30). Let's send all living past presidents, too, and add Congress while we're at it. I can't imagine anything more inspiring than looking to the heavens and knowing all of them are off this planet.

title: 'Call My Agent!' Star Camille Cottin Began as Helen of Troy
summary: Resume Subscription. Camille Cottin, 42, is a French actress who stars in the film "Stillwater" and Netflix 's "Call My Agent!" She co-stars with Lady Gaga, Al Pacino and Adam Driver in "House of Gucci," due in November. She spoke with Marc Myers.

title: Rents Rise as Workers Return to Cities
summary: Landlord stocks are up big this year, as rental market exceeds expectations in places like Atlanta. Apartment rents are rising fast, boosted by young professionals returning to cities and an expensive housing market that keeps many of them renting.

title: Beverage Startups See Money Pour In Following Pandemic Pullback
summary: Nonalcoholic beverages sector fundraising more than doubled in the first half of the year compared with a year ago, according to PitchBook. Ready-to-drink beverage startups are taking advantage of an uptick in venture funding in their sector following a downturn in deals during the worst of the pandemic last year.

title: Facebook Acquisition Review Shows EU's New Antitrust Power
summary: EU's Vestager in March widened scope of deal reviews, part of growing global scrutiny of takeover deals. BRUSSELS- Facebook Inc. has hit a new obstacle in Europe in its planned takeover of a small New York-based startup, showing how antitrust muscle-flexing is increasingly affecting deals an ocean away.

title: Delta Variant Arrives in Wuhan
summary: Wuhan officials order mass testing; Beijing cuts off travel in bid to protect capital from multiplying outbreaks. The city where Covid-19 was first detected reported new infections for the first time in more than a year, prompting authorities there to launch mass testing, as China fights to contain several outbreaks of the more infectious Delta variant.

title: Belarusian Activist's Death Is Investigated as Homicide
summary: Leader of humanitarian organization Belarusian House was found hanged in a park in Kyiv. Here's what we're watching ahead of the opening bell.

summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-One week ago, the U.S. had just been surpassed by the Russians during the gymnastics qualifying round and Simone Biles faced an unquantifiable pressure to go out and win a third consecutive Olympic team title for her country.

summary: Brussels begins using pandemic-recovery money in its escalating culture wars with governments accused of democratic backsliding. title: Deutsche Bank Set to Resume Sponsoring Hong Kong IPOs

summary: After a week of practice and reverberations, she rallies for a record-tying bronze in the balance beam. That's a minor part of her overall impact.. She had a little more left.

A little over two months ago about 4,000 people were dying every day from Covid-19 in India. Yet, on a recent Friday, a rooftop bar in New Delhi was once again packed with crowds of young adults mingling without masks.

summary: Resume Subscription. Law school was once considered a surefire ticket to a comfortable life. Years of tuition increases have made it a fast way to get buried in debt.

summary: U.S. operators seek to shed shopping centers whose values have slid in effort to trim debt. Large property owners are looking to unload more malls through sales or by allowing lenders to take over, brushing aside a recovery in the shopping-center business as more Americans get vaccinated.

summary: Kim Jong Un's regime wants relaxation of sanctions to return to nuclear negotiations, South Korean intelligence officials say. Kim Jong Un's regime wants sanctions restrictions relaxed to allow exporting minerals and importing more refined fuel.

title: China Shuns Ericsson, Nokia as the West Curbs Huawei
summary: Chinese wireless carrier boosts equipment sales to Huawei and reduces its business with Sweden's Ericsson. The U.S. and many of its allies have restricted the use of 5G cellular equipment made by China's Huawei Technologies Co. Now Beijing is doing the same to Huawei's Western rivals.

title: Foot Locker's Sneaker Spree Lacks Cheering Fans

title: For Some, ACA Health Plans Could Be Cheaper-or Even Free
summary: Changes under Covid-19 stimulus bill increased subsidies for 2021 and 2022. title: For Fast Food, Supersized Sales Outrun Heavier Costs
summary: Second-quarter earnings show fast-food companies can still attract customers despite higher labor and food costs. A key question for the fast-food industry is how well it can handle the prospect of rising costs. So far, investors don't have much reason to feel queasy.

summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-The stress of competing in the Olympics during a pandemic has taken its toll on many athletes here. But the home team is handling the pressure and delivering record results.

summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-Everything came together for American hurdler Rai Benjamin to run the single greatest race of his life on Tuesday. He hit his groove early. "It's going to take me forever to get there," she thought then.

title: China Takes Aim at Auto Chip Dealers With Global Supplies Low

title: After Tamarack Fire, the U.S. Plans New Tactics to Fight West's Flames
summary: Resume Subscription. The U.S. Forest Service pledged to more aggressively fight new wildfires that could threaten communities in the drought-ravaged West, after state and local officials criticized it for letting an initially small blaze grow out of control and destroy 14 homes.

summary: Some health experts say agency relies on data that is lacking or inconclusive. title: Bundled Commercial Real-Estate Loans Climb to Sales Record
summary: Investors show an appetite for higher-yielding debt and an expectation that business properties will rebound after Covid-19 shutdowns. Sales of securities backed by riskier commercial real-estate loans have surged to a record, highlighting investors' demand for higher-yielding debt and expectations for a recovery in business properties.

title: There Will Be a New 800-Meter Champion in Tokyo. Thank the Testosterone Rules.
summary: Resume Subscription. Not a single woman who stood on the podium in the 800 meters in Rio will be in the starting blocks for the race final in Tokyo at this Olympics. That owes more to a change in the International Association of Athletics Federations' rules than anything to do with athletic performance.

title: Sanofi Snaps Up mRNA Specialist for $3.2 Billion
summary: French pharmaceutical giant is one of several companies investing in the technology after it brought the world two Covid-19 shots. Sanofi SA agreed to pay $3.2 billion to acquire mRNA specialist Translate Bio, a big vote of confidence that the new technology underpinning two successful Covid-19 vaccines holds promise beyond the pandemic.

title: Tesla Rival Li Auto Launches $2 Billion Hong Kong Share Sale
summary: Nasdaq-listed maker of electric vehicles is pushing ahead with stock sale despite recent selloff in offshore-listed Chinese stocks. Electric-car maker Li Auto Inc. kicked off a near-$2 billion stock offering in Hong Kong, joining a string of U.S.-listed Chinese companies in tapping investors closer to home.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Federal Labor Official Recommends Alabama Amazon Workers Hold New Vote, Union Says
summary: Recommendation comes after RWDSU appealed Amazon's victory in April vote. A National Labor Relations Board official recommended nullifying the results of a closely watched vote in which Amazon.com Inc. warehouse workers in Alabama had rejected a plan to join a union, according to the labor group involved in the case.

title: Belarusian Olympic Sprinter Receives Polish Visa
summary: IOC says Krystsina Tsimanouskaya is safe and in the hands of authorities in Tokyo. TOKYO-A Belarusian Olympic athlete received a Polish visa after she resisted her team's attempts to send her home from Tokyo against her will in the middle of a public dispute, Poland's deputy foreign minister said Monday.
